verses.verse: Then we turned<WH6437>, and took our journey<WH5265> into the wilderness<WH4057> by the way<WH1870> of the Red<WH5488> sea<WH3220>, as the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto me: and we compassed<WH5437> mount<WH2022> Seir<WH8165> many<WH7227> days<WH3117>.
And the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH559> unto me, saying<WH559>,
Ye have compassed<WH5437> this mountain<WH2022> long enough<WH7227>: turn<WH6437> you northward<WH6828>.

And command<WH6680> thou the people<WH5971>, saying<WH559>, Ye are to pass<WH5674> through the coast<WH1366> of your brethren<WH251> the children<WH1121> of Esau<WH6215>, which dwell<WH3427> in Seir<WH8165>; and they shall be afraid<WH3372> of you: take ye good<WH3966> heed<WH8104> unto yourselves therefore:

Meddle<WH1624> not with them; for I will not give<WH5414> you of their land<WH776>, no, not so much as a foot<WH7272> breadth<WH4096> <WH3709>; because I have given<WH5414> mount<WH2022> Seir<WH8165> unto Esau<WH6215> for a possession<WH3425>. no: Heb. even to the treading of the sole of the foot
Ye shall buy<WH7666> meat<WH400> of them for money<WH3701>, that ye may eat<WH398>; and ye shall also buy<WH3739> water<WH4325> of them for money<WH3701>, that ye may drink<WH8354>.

For the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath blessed<WH1288> thee in all the works<WH4639> of thy hand<WH3027>: he knoweth<WH3045> thy walking<WH3212> through this great<WH1419> wilderness<WH4057>: these forty<WH705> years<WH8141> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath been with thee; thou hast lacked<WH2637> nothing<WH1697>.

And when we passed<WH5674> by from our brethren<WH251> the children<WH1121> of Esau<WH6215>, which dwelt<WH3427> in Seir<WH8165>, through the way<WH1870> of the plain<WH6160> from Elath<WH359>, and from Eziongaber<WH6100>, we turned<WH6437> and passed<WH5674> by the way<WH1870> of the wilderness<WH4057> of Moab<WH4124>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me, Distress<WH6696> not the Moabites<WH4124>, neither contend<WH1624> with them in battle<WH4421>: for I will not give<WH5414> thee of their land<WH776> for a possession<WH3425>; because I have given<WH5414> Ar<WH6144> unto the children<WH1121> of Lot<WH3876> for a possession<WH3425>. Distress: or, Use no hostility against Moab
The Emims<WH368> dwelt<WH3427> therein in times past<WH6440>, a people<WH5971> great<WH1419>, and many<WH7227>, and tall<WH7311>, as the Anakims<WH6062>;
Which<WH1992> also were accounted<WH2803> giants<WH7497>, as the Anakims<WH6062>; but the Moabites<WH4125> call<WH7121> them Emims<WH368>.

The Horims<WH2752> also dwelt<WH3427> in Seir<WH8165> beforetime<WH6440>; but the children<WH1121> of Esau<WH6215> succeeded<WH3423> them, when they had destroyed<WH8045> them from before<WH6440> them, and dwelt<WH3427> in their stead; as Israel<WH3478> did<WH6213> unto the land<WH776> of his possession<WH3425>, which the LORD<WH3068> gave<WH5414> unto them. succeeded: Heb. inherited stead: or, room
Now rise up<WH6965>, said I, and get you over<WH5674> the brook<WH5158> Zered<WH2218>. And we went over<WH5674> the brook<WH5158> Zered<WH2218>. brook: or, valley

And the space<WH3117> in which we came<WH1980> from Kadeshbarnea<WH6947>, until we were come over<WH5674> the brook<WH5158> Zered<WH2218>, was thirty<WH7970> and eight<WH8083> years<WH8141>; until all the generation<WH1755> of the men<WH582> of war<WH4421> were wasted out<WH8552> from among<WH7130> the host<WH4264>, as the LORD<WH3068> sware<WH7650> unto them. brook: or, valley
For indeed the hand<WH3027> of the LORD<WH3068> was against them, to destroy<WH2000> them from among<WH7130> the host<WH4264>, until they were consumed<WH8552>.
So it came to pass, when all the men<WH582> of war<WH4421> were consumed<WH8552> and dead<WH4191> from among<WH7130> the people<WH5971>,
That the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto me, saying<WH559>,
Thou art to pass over<WH5674> through Ar<WH6144>, the coast<WH1366> of Moab<WH4124>, this day<WH3117>:

And when thou comest nigh<WH7126> over against<WH4136> the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983>, distress<WH6696> them not, nor meddle<WH1624> with them: for I will not give<WH5414> thee of the land<WH776> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> any possession<WH3425>; because I have given<WH5414> it unto the children<WH1121> of Lot<WH3876> for a possession<WH3425>.
(That also was accounted<WH2803> a land<WH776> of giants<WH7497>: giants<WH7497> dwelt<WH3427> therein in old time<WH6440>; and the Ammonites<WH5984> call<WH7121> them Zamzummims<WH2157>;

A people<WH5971> great<WH1419>, and many<WH7227>, and tall<WH7311>, as the Anakims<WH6062>; but the LORD<WH3068> destroyed<WH8045> them before<WH6440> them; and they succeeded<WH3423> them, and dwelt<WH3427> in their stead:

As he did<WH6213> to the children<WH1121> of Esau<WH6215>, which dwelt<WH3427> in Seir<WH8165>, when he destroyed<WH8045> the Horims<WH2752> from before<WH6440> them; and they succeeded<WH3423> them, and dwelt<WH3427> in their stead even unto this day<WH3117>:

And the Avims<WH5761> which dwelt<WH3427> in Hazerim<WH2699>, even unto Azzah<WH5804>, the Caphtorims<WH3732>, which came forth<WH3318> out of Caphtor<WH3731>, destroyed<WH8045> them, and dwelt<WH3427> in their stead.)

Rise ye up<WH6965>, take your journey<WH5265>, and pass over<WH5674> the river<WH5158> Arnon<WH769>: behold<WH7200>, I have given<WH5414> into thine hand<WH3027> Sihon<WH5511> the Amorite<WH567>, king<WH4428> of Heshbon<WH2809>, and his land<WH776>: begin<WH2490> to possess<WH3423> it, and contend<WH1624> with him in battle<WH4421>. begin: Heb. begin, possess

This day<WH3117> will I begin<WH2490> to put<WH5414> the dread<WH6343> of thee and the fear<WH3374> of thee upon the nations<WH6440> <WH5971> that are under the whole heaven<WH8064>, who shall hear<WH8085> report<WH8088> of thee, and shall tremble<WH7264>, and be in anguish<WH2342> because of thee<WH6440>.
And I sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> out of the wilderness<WH4057> of Kedemoth<WH6932> unto Sihon<WH5511> king<WH4428> of Heshbon<WH2809> with words<WH1697> of peace<WH7965>, saying<WH559>,
Let me pass<WH5674> through thy land<WH776>: I will go<WH3212> along by the high way<WH1870> <WH1870>, I will neither turn<WH5493> unto the right hand<WH3225> nor to the left<WH8040>.

Thou shalt sell<WH7666> me meat<WH400> for money<WH3701>, that I may eat<WH398>; and give<WH5414> me water<WH4325> for money<WH3701>, that I may drink<WH8354>: only I will pass through<WH5674> on my feet<WH7272>;

(As the children<WH1121> of Esau<WH6215> which dwell<WH3427> in Seir<WH8165>, and the Moabites<WH4125> which dwell<WH3427> in Ar<WH6144>, did<WH6213> unto me;) until I shall pass over<WH5674> Jordan<WH3383> into the land<WH776> which the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> us.

But Sihon<WH5511> king<WH4428> of Heshbon<WH2809> would<WH14> not let us pass<WH5674> by him: for the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hardened<WH7185> his spirit<WH7307>, and made his heart<WH3824> obstinate<WH553>, that he might deliver<WH5414> him into thy hand<WH3027>, as appeareth this day<WH3117>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me, Behold<WH7200>, I have begun<WH2490> to give<WH5414> Sihon<WH5511> and his land<WH776> before<WH6440> thee: begin<WH2490> to possess<WH3423>, that thou mayest inherit<WH3423> his land<WH776>.
Then Sihon<WH5511> came out<WH3318> against<WH7125> us, he and all his people<WH5971>, to fight<WH4421> at Jahaz<WH3096>.
And the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430> delivered<WH5414> him before<WH6440> us; and we smote<WH5221> him, and his sons<WH1121>, and all his people<WH5971>.

And we took<WH3920> all his cities<WH5892> at that time<WH6256>, and utterly destroyed<WH2763> the men<WH4962>, and the women<WH802>, and the little ones<WH2945>, of every city<WH5892>, we left<WH7604> none to remain<WH8300>: the men: Heb. every city of men, and women, and little ones
Only the cattle<WH929> we took for a prey<WH962> unto ourselves, and the spoil<WH7998> of the cities<WH5892> which we took<WH3920>.

From Aroer<WH6177>, which is by the brink<WH8193> of the river<WH5158> of Arnon<WH769>, and from the city<WH5892> that is by the river<WH5158>, even unto Gilead<WH1568>, there was not one city<WH7151> too strong<WH7682> for us: the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430> delivered<WH5414> all unto us<WH6440>:

Only unto the land<WH776> of the children<WH1121> of Ammon<WH5983> thou camest<WH7126> not, nor unto any place<WH3027> of the river<WH5158> Jabbok<WH2999>, nor unto the cities<WH5892> in the mountains<WH2022>, nor unto whatsoever the LORD<WH3068> our God<WH430> forbad<WH6680> us.
